[h1][b][i][u]BUY ANYTHING ELSE[/u][/i][/b][/h1]

I have been an Overwatch 2 fan for years. I remember when Hog could hook people through walls, Torb had 3 turret phases, Sym had 6 turrets, Bastion had an infinite turret mode, and Sombra wasn't even a character. The game has had its ups and downs, but I stuck with it. Blizzard has had its flaws, but it at least tried to listen to the fans. I'd spend weeks grinding for enough coins to get a new legendary skin for Reaper, and I enjoyed it. With the announcement of Overwatch 2, we learned that lootboxes were going to be removed, the game was made free, and everything was perfect! No more random lootboxes; now you work towards what you want; now you can even just buy the specific skin instead of paying money for lootboxes; now we’re going to add PVE with a skill tree and completely renovate the game. When the time came for Overwatch 2 to drop, we got far less than we asked for. Blizzard lied; there was no PVE, and the "free to play" came at the cost of being able to reasonably earn almost anything without forking up 10 dollars every few months. I’m not even close to being the first person to point this out. The problem is that Blizzard won’t listen to these people; they only listen to money. If you don’t want other games to be the industry standard, then don’t buy into the hype, don’t buy the battlepass, don’t buy any skins, and don’t act like this is ok. The current state of the game is awful. Spend your money on a cool indie game or something you’ll actually enjoy. Trust me, there are better uses for your hard-earned money than eating out of the palms of a soulless corporation trying to make a cheap dollar off you.

Gather round youngins and let tell you a tale of enjoyment, woe, and stolen breast milk.

I'm probably one of the several that pre-purchased Overwatch on PS4 before the game came out, and I played it for hours on end because it was fun and enjoyable time, especially when I had friends join me as a harassed tanks as Reaper, try to keep alive and panicking as Mercy or Ana, or punch Mercy mains as doomfist and say "CHRIS BROWNED" on my abysmal mic I had at the time.

Last time I played OW was when that fat gerbil wrecking ball came out, at that I was burned out and went to play other games. Fast forward to 2019, they announced the sequel, planned PVE stuff (lol) and just quality of life stuff that OW1 could use. I was like "okay, might hop back in."

And while this game IS fun, it is held back by very predatory business practices.

For those that didn't know, Overwatch 1 had loot boxes that contained cosmetics for heroes and it was always randomized, with the potential to get duplicates (TF2 and Paladins could you all about that.) But instead of being sketchy like many of Blizzard's parent company's rival EA, they were actually thought and done right. The duplicates gave you in game currency so you could purchase a skin you wanted but weren't able to, and those credits were generous themselves, it never felt like gambling since you always got one whenever you leveled up for got three wins in the arcade tab.

Now? They ended up copying and pasting the same shop layout similar to the recent Call of Duty titles (I'd say Fortnite, but even Epic is a little more consumer friendly these days, I just dislike them because of Tencent's stake in them), and the cosmetics are now behind a premium currency and vastly overpriced, which easily infuriated a lot of the OG playerbase and undoubtedly was driven away, especially when we found out that they also implemented the Battle Pass system and made it to where you are out of luck if you don't grind for hours on end. I've done that for the first four passes, skipped the fifth one and I'm likely going to skip this season as well.

And remember, Blizzard (and Activision) has been in hot water for the past couple years, ranging from harassment of all version, including stolen breast milk (I'm not joking, someone did that), which probably hurt OW's image pretty badly.

Is the game fun? Yeah, it holds up and I still like it from time to time, though there are days I would bang my head against the wall when stuck with players that jump into the fray alone without help. 

Do I recommend it? As of now, no. Not with the way they have BP and shop set up and I don't think blizzard will do change much at all. There was also plans of a PVE mode (which was one of the key reasons they announced the "sequel") only to can it later, despite the events known as Archives which was a PVE series (why they didn't just toss it into the core modes as compensation after dropping planned stuff I have no idea). Real shame, I loved this game when it came out, but now I only play it when my friends are down for a few matches.

TL;DR: Being on OW veteran back when the game launched in 2016, seeing OW2 drop the rather generous loot box mechanics (they weren't even predatory either unlike EA's, they were done RIGHT) in favor of a Battle Pass and in game shop like Fortnite's and more accurately CoD's was upsetting to say the least.
